The grand theoretical-mathematical approach to economics is nonsense...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pseudo-scientific\nschool of mathematical economics if for the perfect world run by robots without\nemotions\u2014 where even the weather is math controlled and there can be no domino\neffects-- where there is no subtlety or ambiguity or uncertainty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mayer Amschel (Anselm)\nRothschild, was born in Juddddenstrasse Frankfurt am Main, Germany in 1744, and\nis held to be &nbsp;the founder of the famous\nHouse of Rothschild. But his money lending father &nbsp;had financial interests in bothe Germany and France.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Richard Cantillon</span>\n(1680s \u2013 May 1734) was an Irish-French banker and economist . <span style=\"color: red;\">He wrote the\n<i>Essai sur la Nature du Commerce en G\u00e9n\u00e9ral </i>(Essay on the Nature of Trade in\nGeneral), a book considered by William Stanley Jevons to be the \"cradle of\npolitical economy\" .</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the late 1710s\nand early 1720s, Cantillon speculated in, and later helped fund, John Law's\nMississippi Company, from which he acquired great wealth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t36Q3OK6hwI/UGGK2trzusI/AAAAAAAATF0/01dEmFSRXAU/s1600/sddf.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t36Q3OK6hwI/UGGK2trzusI/AAAAAAAATF0/01dEmFSRXAU/s320/sddf.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cantillon was\ninfluenced by his experiences as a banker Essai is considered the first\ncomplete treatise on economics, with numerous contributions to the science. These\ncontributions include: his cause and effect methodology, monetary theories, his\nconception of the entrepreneur as a risk-bearer, and the development of spatial\neconomics. &nbsp;Adam Smith copied from Cantillon's\nEssai .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In 1716, the French government granted him\nboth permission to found the Banque G\u00e9n\u00e9rale and virtual monopoly over the\nright to develop French territories in North America, named the Mississippi\nCompany. &nbsp;Essai was not published until\n1755 as a result of heavy censorship in France, it did widely circulate in the\nform of an unpublished manuscript between its completion and its publication .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adam Smith lifted Cantillon\u2019s sustenance theory of wages\u2014whole sale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adam Smith not only\ncontributed nothing of value to economic thought; his economics was a grave\ndeterioration from his predecessors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mystery of Adam Smith, then, is the\nimmense gap between a trumped up reputation ( ashe rubbed shoulders with Rothschild ) and the sordid reality. The Wealth of Nations was made to blind all men, economists\nand laymen alike.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Wealth of Nations exerted such a\ncolossal impact on the world thanks to Rothschild and East India Company, that\nall knowledge of previous economists was blotted out, hence Smith's reputation\nas Founding Father.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Enough of false god and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">plagiarist</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Adam Smith and his reflected brilliance!</span></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capitalism has to be\nunderstood and rejected in its entirety.&nbsp;\nCapitalists, do not create wealth.&nbsp; Workers do. Workers are not dependent on the\ncapitalist class but could run society in their own interests within common or co-operative ownership and democratic control. Capitalists are dependent on the exploitation\nof workers for their wealth and attached privileges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capitalism benefits\ncapitalists, not workers . Capitalist economics is the employer's set of\nideas and rules to keep workers in their place. You will not hear Chancellors of the\nExchequer lecturing the CBI to make less profit and give workers higher wages\nbut you will always hear Chancellors telling workers to be more productive and\nnot to take increased pay rises and bonuses.. But one thing they do not have is an\nunderstanding of is their own subject matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economists students must ask how the\nprofession had been blind to the fact that its theories were leading people\ndown the wrong path. The oft repeated paradigm that the market corrects itself,\nis sheer bull. Economists assumption that everyone in an economy can borrow at\nthe same risk-free rate is pure bull.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without a rethink, we\nface the end of growth. We face the end of progress. We face more poverty,\ngreater conflict and rising ill-health. &nbsp;Life expectancies will fall, as will\nstandards of living. In developed countries, health care, savings and pension\npromises will be broken. &nbsp;In the third world hopes for\ndevelopment will not be met. Tensions between peoples will grow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have to re-ground it\nin a new paradigm. A new economics can only be originated by a new outlook on\nvalue and wealth. The GDP cannot be considered a measure for the standard of\nour lives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern Economists (\nespecially the ones who snort Cocaine )&nbsp;\nare strongly influenced by their testosterone levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mainstream economic and\nfinancial models, the ones that currently rule the markets and determine value,\nhave shifted their focus over the years from what is best for the society they\nshould try to model to what is mathematically possible to achieve for maximizing benefit of a few.&nbsp; Most economists and\nfinanciers are nothing more than \u201chands on\u201d mathematical labourers and\ntheir models are pseudo science.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mainstream economic and\nfinancial models pursue an idea of value that is divorced from any concept of\nthe general wealth and well being of human beings and society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prevailing models are\nbased on a totally driven by the\nlust for individual profit. &nbsp;These models are rooted in the win-lose paradigm . They call it \u201ccompetition\u201d and a\ngigantic and ineffective apparatus has been unfairly created to \u201censure\u201d fair\ncompetition.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The starting point is\nto define what the role of the government should be and which policies an\neconomic model should mirror. &nbsp;Any government should first and foremost protect\nthe freedom of its citizens under the constitution. &nbsp;For an Indian who suffered 800 years of slavery \u2014 it\nis&nbsp; freedom from any risk of slavery. We\ndo NOT want to be a banana republic where each and every Minister and&nbsp; MP of the ruling party is paid bribes&nbsp; by huge corporations like Walmart , Vedanta\nor Monsanto.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">We the flies must have\nthe ability to protect ourselves from huge spider enemies and freedom from tyranny. People must have the&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">entrepreneurial</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;freedom to start\nown small \"pop and mom\" ventures and business. There must be a\nnetwork of support for the development of any form of free enterprise.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">None of the economists are prepared to see the obvious because\nit is not in their equations and wish lists. Crap in equals crap out, no matter how you dress\nit up in fancy maths which in any case only a small percentage of people can understand. &nbsp;It's just about bamboozling the masses so they don't query what bull they are being\ntold.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every equation in\nneoclassical economics is rubbish.&nbsp; The\ndifferential equations describe nothing.&nbsp;\nEconomics is not about mathematics,&nbsp;\nit is about the human being-- in a complex country like India. Virtually all\ncommonly held beliefs about economics--whether espoused by \"baffle them\nwith bullshit\" political activists, politicians, journalists or\ntaxpayers-- are just plain wrong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics will always\nbe bullshit because it relies on the premise that human beings behave in a\nsystematic way, when they don\u2019t. We cannot predict consumption/saving/investing\nbehavior in long-lasting ways.&nbsp;\n\"Culture\" is a&nbsp;\ninexplicable, chaotic force that makes economics hopeless.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There's no guarantee\nthat what may &nbsp;hold today will hold tomorrow. Science rests on the assumption that\nthe mechanisms of the Universe are stable. When that assumption fails, economic science\nfails.&nbsp; Even if the macroeconomy is\nincredibly chaotic, the economists use brute-force computer power to make\nshort-term forecasts, like how weather forecasters do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics previously\nwas not a very mathematical science, at least compared to the way it is today. &nbsp;Economists used to write articles with very few equations, or even without any\nequations at all.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-f1TxPL9iYDo/Ur5SzZvqXII/AAAAAAAAoww/XEvHZX_XCzg/s1600/equation.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"214\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-f1TxPL9iYDo/Ur5SzZvqXII/AAAAAAAAoww/XEvHZX_XCzg/s640/equation.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People don\u2019t understand\ncomplicated math, so economists can automatically win arguments with someone\nwho cant understand math.&nbsp; Nowadays,\nmost papers on economics have complex equations in them.&nbsp; All economists have to be able to talk about\ntheir ideas using grandiose mathematical models and statistics, or other economists won\u2019t\nrespect them. This is part of what is called being able to \u201cthink like an dazzling economist.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economists still like\nwearing their 3-D glasses after the 3D Titanic movie is over and they drive\nhome to go to bed with great self importance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics starts with\nassumptions and then tries to do voodoo math with the assumptions. Why are the ignorant and low IQ politicians and commentators who confidently speak economic nonsense treated as\nsages? And why do so many journalists uncritically repeat their nonsense? If not they may lose their jobs, right? &nbsp;The\nnews media lavish on high-profile politicians and pundits who baffle people with confident bull with\nabsolute certainty --on matters about which their own words show they know nothing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Too few people in\npublic life understand economics, numbers or algebra. None of them did Math or Calculus in college. Hardly any remember, the crucial concept underlying matters of economics and finance\nknown as accounting identities.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accounting identities are statements that must\nbe true no matter how you arrange the components. Thus 2+1=3 just as\n3-1=2.&nbsp; Likewise, net worth equals assets\nminus liabilities just as assets equal liabilities plus net worth and profits\nequal revenue minus costs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have NOT yet seen an\neconomist who can solve a simple math below, which even a illiterate chai-wala\nboy in Calcutta can do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Three friends go to a\nbar for drinking beer ( costing 10 dollars a bottle )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>As usual they take out\none 10 dollar bill each from their wallets and gives the waiter,&nbsp; 3 nos 10 dollar&nbsp; notes or 30 dollars.<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The bar owner is in a\nexpansive mood and he tells the waiter -- \"happy hour time! -- give them 5\ndollars back!!-- i will charge only 25 dollars for 3 beers today \".<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The clever waiter knows\n5 dollars cannot be split between 3 regular dutchmen. so he pockets 2 dollars\nand returns 3 one dollar notes .<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The three of them put\nback one dollar each into their respective wallets.&nbsp; Initially each wallet had one 10 dollar\nbill--now it has only one single dollar bill.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now comes the\nperception part:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All three of them spent\n9 dollars each-- 27 dollars total.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The waiter got 2\ndollars.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHERE IS ONE DOLLAR\nGONE-- POOF???<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Be honest to yourself\nand dont read further, till you figure this out.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You tell an accountant\nwithout perception to give you a debit/ credit accounts statement--and see the\nway he sweats.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">See literacy has\nnothing to do with perception.&nbsp; A\nilliterate chaiwala boy in mumbai can make an ass out of you, when it comes to\naccounts.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Daft accountants make a\nmistake when it comes to \"receipts\" and \" balance \".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here in this case it is\n- 30+0= 27+3.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Opening cash + receipts\n= spent cash+ balance cash.&nbsp; It can never\never be 30-3+2=29<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">See, you cant argue\nwith dorks.&nbsp;&nbsp; 2 dollars is something\nwhich happened in the mann mandir of the waiter.&nbsp; How do you know that he stole 2 dollars ?&nbsp;&nbsp; Accounting has to be objective.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">This is where the\neconomists confidence goes for a toss.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-q2lvizCon6c/Ur5TAfJd-hI/AAAAAAAAow4/lNzE7lvutWo/s1600/alt-ltmb-3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"540\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-q2lvizCon6c/Ur5TAfJd-hI/AAAAAAAAow4/lNzE7lvutWo/s640/alt-ltmb-3.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In economics, Gross\nDomestic Product equals consumer spending plus government spending plus\ninvestment plus the net of exports and imports.&nbsp;\nOr in its simplest form: Spending = Output = Income.&nbsp; One can predict that , over the long term, if\nmarginal costs exceeds marginal revenues, then a firm will go broke.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economists are charlatans hired by politicians to push a particular point of view, masquerading as sure science. Politicians know very well how to fix the economy, but their masters,\nblinded by greed, refuse to let go. &nbsp;Our minds are raped &nbsp;with the scientific nonsense. It is all about greed. That is the only element\ndriving our economic system, which is called capitalism, is greed.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qQNAW64eKPY/UGGjKF-yeKI/AAAAAAAATHo/Wh7gX1ki6CU/s1600/errtt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"280\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qQNAW64eKPY/UGGjKF-yeKI/AAAAAAAATHo/Wh7gX1ki6CU/s1600/errtt.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economic models try to\nsimulate the real universe of commerce, with idiotic assumptions based on SCANTY INFORMATION , which of course will lead to stupid predictions. Natural science models can predict more accurately because they deal with simple inputs. &nbsp;Human behavior can never ever be a simple input.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern economics is\nobsessed with modelling.&nbsp; A mathematical\nmodel is a predictive tool created to demonstrate the outcome of events in a over simplified alternate universe.&nbsp;\nMathematical economic theories cannot accurately predict the future. This is NOT a calculation like low tide-high tide or sunrise- sunset time.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Physicists can very accurately model the trajectories of rocks in space. But\neconomists cannot accurately model the trajectories of prices, employment and\ninterest rates down on the rocky terrain. So they make the map more important\nthat the terrain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics \u2014 and\neconomic decisions, from the macro to the micro level \u2014 is a human subject. It\nis subtle and psychological and sporadic. A human subject requires human language,\nhuman emotion, human intuition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The grand\ntheoretical-mathematical approach to economics is fundamentally flawed. Trying\nto smudge the human reality of economics and politics into cold mathematical\nshackles is degenerative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pseudo-scientific school\nof mathematical economics hungers and craves for a perfect world, where each\nriver is the same, where there is no butterfly effect, where human preferences\nare expressed in equation form, where there is no subtlety or ambiguity or\nuncertainty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics students\nwaste 3 years, learning to fiddle with budget constraints and production\nfunctions, and using constrained maximisation to solve irrelevant problems that\nare completely detached from reality.&nbsp;\nThey are given completely arbitrary utility functions and aren't told\nwhy those functions are appropriate to use. And then, when they have&nbsp; solved these archiac problems, they are\ntold&nbsp; that it \"proves\" that the\nfree market works, and that the price signal ensures efficiency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole purpose of\neconomics is to justify the status quo, to act as apologists for environmental\ndegradation, income inequality and neoliberal capitalism. If the student tries\nto innovate with ethical arguments he is accused of&nbsp; not \"thinking like an\neconomist\".&nbsp; He is supposed to argue\non behalf of the delusional Adam Smith that throwing people out on the streets\nis the rational policy to pursue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">I honestly don't see\nwhy economics continues to be taught . It is a complete pseudoscientific\ndiscipline with no redeeming features that has contributed to a huge number of\nproblems in this world.&nbsp; It's no better\nthan withcraft, and it's consequences are much more severe</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We need people to start\nspeaking out against this discredited \"science\" before it damages any\nmore lives.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We need to take away hoarded OLD 100/ 500/ 1000 rupee notes-- and have noted with better tracking facility and security.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Human Race will\nonly make progress once economics is no longer subsidised and taught at our\nprestigious universities, and is only mentioned in history classes as a prime\nexample of a discredited science from the past.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How can you justify an\nacademic discipline that's sole purpose is to act as apologists for an economic\nsystem that has failed a significant percentage of the world population and\nit's inherent weaknesses responsible for the worst financial crisis since the\nWall Street Crash? I'm NOT saying that we should only be taught Marxist theory,\nbut there is no balance in economics whatsoever.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subject is completely\ndivorced from reality, and when empirical evidence goes against theories (like,\nas if if reality doesn't correspond to right wing theory, it's reality that's\nto blame. No proper science would operate like this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever scholars from\nother disciplines try to debunk economic theories, they're called left wing\nidiots. When other heterodox economists criticise economics, they're called\ncranks, without any attempt to rationally debate their arguments.&nbsp;&nbsp; Economists love presenting their work as\nscientific&nbsp; however, many of their\ntheories can never ever be reliable tested, because people's\n\"utility\" functions simply cannot be measured in any sense<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">80% of economics these\ndays is empirical.&nbsp; Economics is a\ncomplete pseudoscientific discipline with no redeeming features that has\ncontributed to a huge number of problems in this world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In science, theories\nand models are tested against reality. If they are contradicted by confirmed\nevents, theories are either modified or rejected. In the long run there is a\nwinnowing out process which selects one or a few theories as being most probably\ncorrect. &nbsp;In a pseudoscience, no such winnowing out occurs: when confronted with\nstrong evidence against a pseudoscientific theory, either the evidence is\ndismissed whole sale or reinterpreted to conform to theory.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Or the theory is reinterpreted\nto make it consistent with the data. Abandonment of the theory is never even an\noption. There has been no winnowing out of economic theories. When an\n\"impossible\" event occurs the theory is simply tweaked and reinterpreted to conform to the new situation. So we have unstable sky scrapers, too dangerous to live in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nobody in thier senses will ever say that that\neconomics is even a science in the strictest definition of the term. &nbsp;Social\nSciences in general are not science in it\u2019s strictest sense. To hold economics\nor political science to the strictest scientific method is impossible..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Production of wealth\nshould NEVER be tied to its distribution. The former is in the field of\n\"applied economics\" while the latter belongs to \"social\neconomics\" and is largely a matter of power and politics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the best\neconomists cannot make exact predictions about future events. What is the\ncurrent state of economics today? &nbsp;Contemporary economics appears to rest in a\nstate of polarization between two opposing philosophies: capitalism and\nneo-Marxism.&nbsp; Both are flawed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics fails to take\ninto account human nature as the greatest driver of behavior and when it does, it does NOT understand culture and priorities .Human nature is studied in the subfield\nof behavioral economics, which essentially tries to explain why people are\n\u201cirrational.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantitative metrics,\nsuch as per-capita income and median income, are flawed, primarily because they\ncan easily be skewed by the higher wealth of small communities where wealth is\nhighly centralized. Qualitative metrics and sociological examination are\nneeded.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PUT ON YOUR HEAD PHONES AND LISTEN TO THE VIDEO BELOW--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://2.gvt0.com/vi/R--1IHumSKo/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/R--1IHumSKo&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/R--1IHumSKo&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">How did the crash of\n2009 happen?<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>QUOTE</b> : Before the recession\n,&nbsp; the 2002\u20132008 period encouraged\nhigh-risk lending and borrowing practices; international trade imbalances;\nreal-estate bubbles that have since burst; fiscal policy choices related to\ngovernment revenues and expenses; and approaches used by nations to bail out\ntroubled banking industries and private bondholders, assuming private debt\nburdens or socializing losses.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The U.S. Financial\nCrisis Inquiry Commission reported its findings in January 2011. It concluded\nthat \"the crisis was avoidable and was caused by: Widespread failures in\nfinancial regulation, including the Federal Reserve\u2019s failure to stem the tide\nof toxic mortgages; Dramatic breakdowns in corporate governance including too\nmany financial firms acting recklessly and taking on too much risk; An\nexplosive mix of excessive borrowing and risk by households and Wall Street\nthat put the financial system on a collision course with crisis; Key policy\nmakers ill prepared for the crisis, lacking a full understanding of the\nfinancial system they oversaw; and systemic breaches in accountability and\nethics at all levels.\u201c<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Author Upton Sinclair\n(1878\u20131968) famously stated: \"It is difficult to get a man to understand\nsomething when his job depends on not understanding it.\"<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the years leading up\nto the crisis, the top four U.S. depository banks moved an estimated $5.2\ntrillion in assets and liabilities off-balance sheet into these SIV's and\nconduits. This enabled them to essentially bypass existing regulations\nregarding minimum capital ratios, thereby increasing leverage and profits\nduring the boom but increasing losses during the crisis. As the shadow banking\nsystem expanded to rival or even surpass conventional banking in importance,\npoliticians and government officials should have realized that they were\nre-creating the kind of financial vulnerability that made the Great Depression\npossible\u2014and they should have responded by extending regulations and the\nfinancial safety net to cover these new institutions.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">As long as the damage\ncaused to people, cultures, and ecosystems is not denominated in money, it is\nin the realm of other, off the balance sheet. The same goes for business\naccounting, in which costs can only be externalized when the payer is, again,\noff the balance sheet\u2014an other. To the extent that we identify with our communities,\nwe cannot export costs to them.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By pursuing his own\ninterest he frequently promotes that of the society more effectually than when\nhe really intends to promote it.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7R5qjl43-1E/UGFkrnUBd6I/AAAAAAAATDA/c6HhqEU25gU/s1600/imagesFFGH.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7R5qjl43-1E/UGFkrnUBd6I/AAAAAAAATDA/c6HhqEU25gU/s1600/imagesFFGH.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>shadow banking\nsystem</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> is the collection of financial entities, infrastructure and practices\nwhich support financial transactions that occur beyond the reach of existing\nstate sanctioned monitoring and regulation. It includes entities such as hedge\nfunds, money market funds and structured investment vehicles (SIV). Investment\nbanks may conduct much of their business in the shadow banking system (SBS),\nbut most are not SBS institutions themselves.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Wb0nZtteNoU/UGFkwMIxdbI/AAAAAAAATDI/1i4iNKSk2CI/s1600/8900.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Wb0nZtteNoU/UGFkwMIxdbI/AAAAAAAATDI/1i4iNKSk2CI/s1600/8900.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The core activities of\ninvestment banks are subject to regulation and monitoring by central banks and\nother government institutions - but it has been common practice for investment\nbanks to conduct many of their transactions in ways that don't show up on their\nconventional balance sheet accounting and so are not visible to regulators or\nunsophisticated investors.For example, prior to the financial crisis,\ninvestment banks financed mortgages through off-balance sheet securitizations\nand hedged risk through off-balance sheet credit default swaps.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XqHKesF35zA/UGFk0REVI2I/AAAAAAAATDQ/3wONMKTHZ4U/s1600/IUTR.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XqHKesF35zA/UGFk0REVI2I/AAAAAAAATDQ/3wONMKTHZ4U/s1600/IUTR.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The volume of\ntransactions in the shadow banking system grew dramatically after the year\n2000. By late 2007 the size of the SBS in the U.S. exceeded $10 trillion and by\nlate 2011 had increased to $24 trillion according to the Financial Stability\nBoard. Globally, a study of the 11 largest national shadow banking systems\nfound that they totalled to $50 trillion in 2007, fell to $47 trillion in 2008\nbut by late 2011 had climbed to $51 trillion, just over its estimated size\nbefore the crisis. Overall, the world wide SBS totalled to about $60 trillion\nas of late 2011.Shadow institutions do not accept deposits like a depository\nbank and therefore are not subject to the same regulations. Complex legal\nentities comprising the system include hedge funds, structured investment\nvehicles (SIV), special purpose entity conduits (SPE), money market funds,\nrepurchase agreement (repo) markets and other non-bank financial institutions.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-NhYKKJFJcGk/UGFlQHWpwEI/AAAAAAAATDw/JuKQv8EFetI/s1600/images+(10).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-NhYKKJFJcGk/UGFlQHWpwEI/AAAAAAAATDw/JuKQv8EFetI/s1600/images+(10).jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Shadow banking\ninstitutions are typically intermediaries between investors and borrowers. For\nexample, an institutional investor like a pension fund may be willing to lend\nmoney, while a corporation may be searching for funds to borrow. The shadow\nbanking institution will channel funds from the investor(s) to the corporation,\nprofiting either from fees or from the difference in interest rates between\nwhat it pays the investor(s) and what it receives from the borrower.The shadow\nbanking system makes up 25 to 30 percent of the total financial system, according\nto the Financial Stability Board (FSB), a regulatory task force for the world's\ngroup of top 20 economies .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">This largely\nunregulated sector was worth about $60 trillion in 2010,.Like traditional\nbanks, shadow banks provide credit and liquidity but, unlike their traditional\ncounterparts, they do not have access to central bank funding or safety nets\nlike deposit insurance. Unlike traditional banks, shadow banks do not take\ndeposits. Instead, they rely on short-term funding provided either by\nasset-backed commercial paper or by the repo market, in which borrowers offer\ncollateral as security against a cash loan and then sell the security to a\nlender and agree to repurchase it at an agreed time in the future for an agreed\nprice. They are often based in tax havens, invest in long-term loans like\nmortgages, providing credit across the financial system by matching investors\nand borrowers individually or by becoming part of a chain involving numerous\nentities, some of which may be mainstream banks.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-V7nq7-4AlI0/UGFk5obI2GI/AAAAAAAATDY/u8YQScRUNDw/s1600/SSFGH.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-V7nq7-4AlI0/UGFk5obI2GI/AAAAAAAATDY/u8YQScRUNDw/s400/SSFGH.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">As shadow banks do not\ntake deposits, they are subject to less regulation than traditional banks. They\ncan therefore increase the rewards they get from investments by leveraging up\nmuch more than their mainstream counterparts and this can lead to risks\nmounting in the financial system. Unregulated shadow institutions can be used\nto circumvent the strictly regulated mainstream banking system and therefore\navoid rules designed to prevent financial crises.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In January 2012, the\nglobal Financial Stability Board announced its intention to further regulate\nthe shadow banking system, in the interests of the real economy.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The full extent of the\nshadow banking system was not widely recognised until work was published in\n2010 by Manmohan Singh and James Aitken of the International Monetary Fund,\nshowing that when the role of rehypothecation was considered, in the U.S. the\nSBS had grown to over $10 trillion, about twice as much as previous estimates.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">This been implicated as\nsignificantly contributing to the global financial crisis of 2007\u20132012.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pHPjmADARWI/UGFlVFJ-V3I/AAAAAAAATD4/RlKQht06yWg/s1600/YUI00.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"238\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pHPjmADARWI/UGFlVFJ-V3I/AAAAAAAATD4/RlKQht06yWg/s320/YUI00.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The rapid increase of\nthe dependency of bank and non-bank financial institutions on the use of these\noff-balance sheet entities to fund investment strategies had made them critical\nto the credit markets underpinning the financial system as a whole, despite\ntheir existence in the shadows, outside of the regulatory controls governing\ncommercial banking activity. Furthermore, these entities were vulnerable\nbecause they borrowed short-term in liquid markets to purchase long-term,\nilliquid and risky assets. This meant that disruptions in credit markets would\nmake them subject to rapid deleveraging, selling their long-term assets at\ndepressed prices.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KZN05bxOUS0/UGFlaNIJAgI/AAAAAAAATEA/5IiD64uDMto/s1600/images+(20).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KZN05bxOUS0/UGFlaNIJAgI/AAAAAAAATEA/5IiD64uDMto/s1600/images+(20).jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Economist Paul Krugman\ndescribed the run on the shadow banking system as the \"core of what happened\"\nto cause the crisis. \"As the shadow banking system expanded to rival or\neven surpass conventional banking in importance, politicians and government\nofficials should have realized that they were re-creating the kind of financial\nvulnerability that made the Great Depression possible\u2014and they should have\nresponded by extending regulations and the financial safety net to cover these\nnew institutions. Influential figures should have proclaimed a simple rule:\nanything that does what a bank does, anything that has to be rescued in crises\nthe way banks are, should be regulated like a bank.\" He referred to this\nlack of controls as \"malign neglect.\" <b>UNQUOTE</b></span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://1.gvt0.com/vi/qs35t2xFqdU/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/qs35t2xFqdU&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/qs35t2xFqdU&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Human welfare is best measured by the\nmarket-based national product accounts (per capita products)<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Age of Enlightenment society\nflourished, propelled by the wonder of new discoveries, radical ideas for\neconomic and social development, and a sense that we all had a responsibility\nto improve our world. &nbsp;It's time to get back to those lofty ideals, step back , examine and re-evaluate our values, and work out what humankind really needs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economic theory abstracts from virtually anything having to do with time. &nbsp;All of it is a 3D graph\u2014time\nmust be taken into account. &nbsp;We are NOT intelligent or perceptive to talk in 4D.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Economists must be\nlateral thinkers!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://2.gvt0.com/vi/fvPpAPIIZyo/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/fvPpAPIIZyo&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/fvPpAPIIZyo&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATLAS SHRUGGED was\nwritten in 1957, by a Jewish Russian American by the name of Ayn Rand ( Alisa\nRosenbaum , born 1905 , from St Petersberg ) . She has put herself in the book\nas Dagney Taggart--the heroine. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hero was of course\nJohn Galt, who is clearly Phillipe Rothschild. The book glorifies capitalism\nand the virtues of selfishness-- typical of Zionist bankers and Free Masons. John\nGalt does not make an appearance in the novel till it is 2/3 over. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4j7flOL6blE/Ur5ROfVnreI/AAAAAAAAowk/v_IiJJ9CxtY/s1600/119891fjnfc560.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"434\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4j7flOL6blE/Ur5ROfVnreI/AAAAAAAAowk/v_IiJJ9CxtY/s640/119891fjnfc560.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But he gets a great\nintroduction -- rather his reputation precedes him, by the constant corny brain\nthumpin' refrain \" Who is John Galt? \"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- the readers are now\nin the common quest to discover this answer rivalling the holy grail .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As the bullshit plot unfolds John Galt is turn\nout to be a creative inventor, the great all American Jewish capitalist who has\nall the grey matter and moolah. He and his Jewish industrial leader ilk are\nsupposed to hold the burden of this planet- like how Atlas held up the whole\nworld on his shoulders , as per Greek mythology.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vv-0u65v_nM/UGGnrqB_oTI/AAAAAAAATIQ/F-sQzC7viNM/s1600/RYIOOP.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-sPkp8hrOymY/UGGltnz9a9I/AAAAAAAATIA/fwBsAzE9glo/s1600/dfhji.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-sPkp8hrOymY/UGGltnz9a9I/AAAAAAAATIA/fwBsAzE9glo/s1600/dfhji.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This bail out money\nwould be the common poor mans' future tax burden.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US Federal Reserve\nwhich is a private Zionist Jewish organisation ( it is NOT owned by US\ngovernment ) injected billions of dollars into the American banking system. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; When bees\nare affected by pesticides they inbuilt radars get shut down, and they get\nlost.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This evil monster has taken away the age old farmers right to use their\nown grown seeds .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">We have to buy\nseeds from Monsanto , as </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Monsanto GM seeds&nbsp; are terminator seeds or sterile seeds. And\nlike how Bill Gates changes the Windows version , Monsanto also started their\nVersion 1 , Version 2.2 seeds--or-- second / third generation seeds.&nbsp; So the farmers had to borrow money from money\nlenders, and get themselves into a debt trap, with declining yield crops.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ct2_dgOx2jo/UGKwzoS9xtI/AAAAAAAATMA/75OYSbFNKCQ/s1600/untitledinv.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"227\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ct2_dgOx2jo/UGKwzoS9xtI/AAAAAAAATMA/75OYSbFNKCQ/s320/untitledinv.png\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contrary\nto Monsanto claims genetically engineered seeds does NOT increase the yield.\nThe Monsanto method has given birth to Super Weeds and Super Pests, as they\nbecome resilient. Ground water is now polluted as more deadly pesticides have\nto be used in greater doses.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Honestly Indians are being used as\nguinea pigs , all under the blessings of our politicians and foreign funded\ndouble agent NGOs--who have Swiss bank accounts. Our\nold people get Alzhiemers which was never heard of in India thanks to GM seeds.\nWhom do we need to thank?</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">US President Obama has filled up all important posts with Monsanto stooges--&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roger Beachy, former\ndirector of the Monsanto Danforth Center, Michael Taylor, former vice-president\nfor public policy for Monsanto, Tom Vilsack., Hillary Clinton, Islam Siddiqui, , Ramona Romero,\nRajiv Shah, Elena Kagan . , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PMI number should NOT\nbe based on large corporations like Reliance, Tata etc, but it must take into\naccount small and medium sized enterprises (SME), which is more indicative\u2014for a\ncomplex country like India. &nbsp;Poor SME\nhealth ( be aware of trend) of less than 35 out of 100, will indicate that the overall state of the Indian economy is in a bad state..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vcgTGOV3g4s/Ur5Q-nz4JCI/AAAAAAAAowU/zo5yXYscuMA/s1600/banks-interest-rates-diagram.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vcgTGOV3g4s/Ur5Q-nz4JCI/AAAAAAAAowU/zo5yXYscuMA/s1600/banks-interest-rates-diagram.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When my ship was discharging Clay Slurry at Vancouver Nanaimo island, a Norwegian Supercargo came on board. &nbsp;We had to prepare to load MEG FG for UCC with chlorides less than 0.29 ppm. My Chief officer remarked. This Super cargo is very resourceful, considering how well he managed things ashore. &nbsp;So I told him \" His next assignment is in Chittagong. I will bet my bottom dollar, that he wont go there, and pretend that he is sick\" .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And I was right, as proved later.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Get the drift of what is Bangladesh specific and Canada specific?&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economics is the only educational\nfield where students become more evil as they progress.
